member.name: T:PHRPReader.clsModificationDefinition.ModificationTypeConstants
member.summary: Modification types

member.name: F:PHRPReader.clsModificationDefinition.ModificationTypeConstants.UnknownType
member.summary: Unknown mod type on a residue; essentially treated as a dynamic mod

member.name: F:PHRPReader.clsModificationDefinition.ModificationTypeConstants.DynamicMod
member.summary: Dynamic mod on a residue or peptide terminus; supported by Sequest and notated via a modification symbol; this mod is explicitly notated by X!Tandem; if a terminus mod, the mod symbol is associated with the first or last residue in the peptide

member.name: F:PHRPReader.clsModificationDefinition.ModificationTypeConstants.StaticMod
member.summary: Static mod on a residue or peptide terminus; supported by Sequest but not explicitly notated; this mod is explicitly notated by X!Tandem; if a terminus mod, the mod symbol is associated with the first or last residue in the peptide

member.name: F:PHRPReader.clsModificationDefinition.ModificationTypeConstants.TerminalPeptideStaticMod
member.summary: Peptide terminus static mod (DMS Symbol is T); used by Sequest and MSGFDB; note that terminal mods are always dynamic in X!Tandem

member.name: F:PHRPReader.clsModificationDefinition.ModificationTypeConstants.IsotopicMod
member.summary: Isotopic mod, e.g. N15, or C13; supported by Sequest; most likely not supported by XTandem

member.name: F:PHRPReader.clsModificationDefinition.ModificationTypeConstants.ProteinTerminusStaticMod
member.summary: Protein terminus static mod; supported by Sequest; this mod is also supported by X!Tandem but modified residues are not explicitly notated; instead, all peptides have their mass implicitly modified by this amount

member.name: F:PHRPReader.clsModificationDefinition.mModificationSymbol
member.summary: One letter symbol for this modification; use NO_SYMBOL_MODIFICATION_SYMBOL if no symbol (necessary for isotopic mods or protein terminus static mods)

member.name: F:PHRPReader.clsModificationDefinition.mModificationMass
member.summary: Monoisotopic modification mass

member.name: F:PHRPReader.clsModificationDefinition.mTargetResidues
member.summary: Target residues, tracked as a space-free, comma-free list of one letter amino acid residue symbols that this mod can apply to Use the *_SYMBOL_DMS constants for the peptide and protein termini symbols (< and > for the peptide termini; [ and ] for the protein termini)
member.remarks: If this is empty, the given modification can apply to any residue or terminus

member.name: F:PHRPReader.clsModificationDefinition.mMassCorrectionTag
member.summary: Name associated with the given ModificationMass; maximum length is 8 characters Cannot contain a colon, comma, or space

member.name: F:PHRPReader.clsModificationDefinition.mAffectedAtom
member.summary: Set to Nothing or to clsPeptideMassCalculator.NO_AFFECTED_ATOM_SYMBOL for positional modifications (including terminus modifications) For Isotopic modifications, indicate the atom affected (e.g. C, H, N, O, or S)

member.name: P:PHRPReader.clsModificationDefinition.ModificationSymbol
member.summary: One letter symbol for this modification
member.remarks: Use NO_SYMBOL_MODIFICATION_SYMBOL (a dash) if no symbol (necessary for isotopic mods or protein terminus static mods)

member.name: P:PHRPReader.clsModificationDefinition.ModificationMass
member.summary: Monoisotopic modification mass

member.name: P:PHRPReader.clsModificationDefinition.ModificationMassAsText
member.summary: Modification mass, stored as text
member.remarks: Represents the original string value read from the data file

member.name: P:PHRPReader.clsModificationDefinition.TargetResidues
member.summary: Residues that this modification can apply to
member.remarks: If an empty string, the modification can apply to any residue or terminus; Otherwise, should contain a space-free, comma-free list of one letter amino acid residue symbols that this mod can apply to. Use the *_SYMBOL_DMS constants for the peptide and protein termini symbols (less than and greater than signs for the peptide termini; [ and ] for the protein termini)

member.summary: Modification type

member.name: T:PHRPReader.clsPeptideCleavageStateCalculator
member.summary: This class will compute the cleavage state and terminus state of a given peptide sequence. It can also be used to remove modification symbols from a sequence using ExtractCleanSequenceFromSequenceWithMods
member.remarks:
The sequence can simply contain single-letter amino acid symbols (capital letters) or a mix of amino acid symbols and modification symbols, for example: A.BCDEFGHIJK.L A.B*CDEFGHIJK.L A.BCDEFGHIJK*.L A.BCDEFGHIJK.L
Function ComputeCleavageState is overloaded to either except the peptide sequence with prefix and suffix letters (e.g. A.BCDEFGHIJK.L) or accept the primary peptide sequence, the prefix residue(s), and the suffix residue(s).
Use EnzymeMatchSpec to specify the residues to match for cleavage
The default cleavage specification is for trypsin: [KR]|[^P]
Note: Function SplitPrefixAndSuffixFromSequence will change peptides that look like: E.TGMLTQKFARSLGMLAVDNQARV.. to E.TGMLTQKFARSLGMLAVDNQARV. or ..TGMLTQKFARSLGMLAVDNQARV.R to .TGMLTQKFARSLGMLAVDNQARV.R

member.summary: Looks for an existing modification with the given modification mass and target residues

member.name: T:PHRPReader.clsPHRPReader
member.summary:
This class reads a tab-delimited text file (created by the Peptide File Extractor or by PHRP) and returns the data for each peptide hit search result
It also integrates MSGF results with the peptide hit search results And, it integrates scan stats values (to determine elution time)

member.name: P:PHRPReader.clsPSM.MSGFSpecProb

member.name: P:PHRPReader.clsPSM.NumTrypticTermini
member.summary: Number of tryptic termini (or similar if not using trypsin)
